Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?




Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




● Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

● Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

● Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

● Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

● Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

● Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.




REQUIREMENTS:




● Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

● Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

● Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

● Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.

● At least one year of working experience in applied ML projects.




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields




NICE TO HAVE:

● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)




SOFT SKILLS:

A problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset.
Exceptional communication skills and meticulous attention to detail.
A team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Passionate about process innovation and driven by curiosity to understand and optimize business processes.







LOCATION:

Milan




WHAT WE OFFER:

COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT

Our history, as well as the future, is based on the value of our people. The biggest investment at Prometeia is in our people, and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it 'Total Compensation' and is made up of Compensation - consisting of a fixed and a variable component -, an important Welfare Plan, active since 2015 – we have been among the first to introduce it in Italy - and Benefits, which include all the initiatives undertaken for the well-being of our people.




REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of the way we work. At Prometeia, smart working is an organizational method based on trust, which results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results, through autonomy and empowerment of people.




PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of people and their continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Transparent discussions between managers and team members are set up within the projects, where reciprocal and timely feedback is exchanged. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the development trajectory of the individual and the company.




TRAINING

Prometeia means ongoing training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. Particular attention is paid to younger colleagues, who are the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important, through immediate and direct confrontation with the market.




WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees, and you recommend a person who is later recruited, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.




PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

Through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia, we have completely digitalized and integrated the management of our physical and virtual environments. Access to the office, smart working, workstations, meeting rooms, car pooling... everything is just a click away.




COMMUNITY

Our Community is extremely diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations that are directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities with which we actively collaborate, are stakeholders representing a great value for us, in terms of trust and collaboration.




DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the selection phase to everyday life, also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and unicities.




IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, the territories and the communities in which we operate. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards that recognizes the performance of the building in terms of energy and water savings, reduction of CO2 emissions, improvement of the ecological quality of the interior, materials and resources used. In the Sustainability Report we report the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda that, drafted by the United Nations in 2016, we have been supporting since 2020.

Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist


Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?


Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


● Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

● Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

● Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

● Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

● Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

● Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.


REQUIREMENTS:


● Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

● Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

● Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

● Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.

● At least one year of working experience in applied ML projects.


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields


NICE TO HAVE:

● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)


SOFT SKILLS:

  • A problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset.
  • Exceptional communication skills and meticulous attention to detail.
  • A team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Passionate about process innovation and driven by curiosity to understand and optimize business processes.



LOCATION:

Milan


WHAT WE OFFER:

COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT

Our history, as well as the future, is based on the value of our people. The biggest investment at Prometeia is in our people, and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it 'Total Compensation' and is made up of Compensation - consisting of a fixed and a variable component -, an important Welfare Plan, active since 2015 – we have been among the first to introduce it in Italy - and Benefits, which include all the initiatives undertaken for the well-being of our people.


REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of the way we work. At Prometeia, smart working is an organizational method based on trust, which results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results, through autonomy and empowerment of people.


PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of people and their continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Transparent discussions between managers and team members are set up within the projects, where reciprocal and timely feedback is exchanged. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the development trajectory of the individual and the company.


TRAINING

Prometeia means ongoing training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. Particular attention is paid to younger colleagues, who are the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important, through immediate and direct confrontation with the market.


WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees, and you recommend a person who is later recruited, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.


PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

Through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia, we have completely digitalized and integrated the management of our physical and virtual environments. Access to the office, smart working, workstations, meeting rooms, car pooling... everything is just a click away.


COMMUNITY

Our Community is extremely diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations that are directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities with which we actively collaborate, are stakeholders representing a great value for us, in terms of trust and collaboration.


DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the selection phase to everyday life, also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and unicities.


IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, the territories and the communities in which we operate. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards that recognizes the performance of the building in terms of energy and water savings, reduction of CO2 emissions, improvement of the ecological quality of the interior, materials and resources used. In the Sustainability Report we report the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda that, drafted by the United Nations in 2016, we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: Applied AI Engineer
Description:
Apply

Job Type

Full-time

Description

Propio is on a mission to make communication accessible to everyone. As a leader in real-time interpretation and multilingual language services, we connect people with the information they need across language, culture, and modality. We’re committed to building AI-powered tools to enhance interpreter workflows, automate multilingual insights, and scale communication quality across industries.

We are hiring an Applied AI Engineer to build and deploy practical, high-impact AI systems. You will work across speech recognition, large language models, and prompt engineering to ship products like AI-generated summaries, interpreter QA tools, and multilingual retrieval systems. You'll operate at the intersection of engineering, research, and product with high ownership and startup-level pace.

This is a builder role, not a research-only position and you will be working closely with our VP of AI to get things live, fast.

Key Responsibilities


Prototype, build, and deploy end-to-end AI applications involving speech, LLMs, and text generation
Integrate APIs like OpenAI, Whisper, Deepgram, and open-source equivalents for ASR and NLP
Collaborate with Engineers to iterate and refine MVPs before transitioning to model-level optimization
Develop internal tools and dashboards to test summarization, QA scoring, and multilingual understanding
Rapidly test ideas and model variations to explore feasibility and impact (build-measure-learn loop)
Ensure model pipelines are robust, scalable, and ready for handoff to MLOps and production
Work with the AI PM to align technical outputs with business use cases and feedback loops
Stay current on applied AI trends in speech and LLMs, and advise on what to use vs. build


Requirements

Qualifications:


Master’s Degree in Engineering, preferably in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science or equivalent work related experience
3–5+ years of experience working with NLP or speech models in real-world applications
Experience with Python, Hugging Face Transformers, OpenAI APIs, Whisper, LangChain, or similar frameworks
Experience deploying AI models in production or pilot environments (e.g., using FastAPI, Flask, or Streamlit)
Strong understanding of embeddings, prompt chaining, and pipeline orchestration
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate)
Comfortable with rapid iteration, MVP mindset, and cross-functional collaboration
Prior exposure to multilingual or low-resource language challenges is a plus


Preferred Qualifications


Experience building speech-to-text pipelines or hybrid ASR + LLM systems
Experience with data labeling, annotation, or active learning workflows
Familiarity with real-time audio processing or latency-sensitive applications
Experience in healthcare, legal, or regulated environments (HIPAA, PHI, Section 1557)
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
WHO'S SHOPFULLY? 📍


Shopfully is the tech company leader in Drive To Store 🛒 that connects millions of shoppers with the stores around them. We help people save time and money and make smarter shopping decisions and we support retailers and brands engaging with consumers throughout the customer journey, from online research to in-store shopping.


With our proprietary websites and apps, a network of publishers and digital platforms and our proprietary tech solutions, we reach 200 millions users globally.


We joined MEDIA Central Group in 2023 and we are now a partner to over 500 top retailers and brands in 25 countries across Europe 🇪🇺, Australia 🇦🇺 and Latin America 🇧🇷.


But we keep on growing, as a matter of fact, we’ve recently teamed up with Flipp, landing into the US 🇺🇸 and Canadian 🇨🇦 markets, with the aim of creating an advanced digital merchandising network that will revolutionize how retailers and brands with consumers.


We’re a team of over 450 people focused on Digital Retail, spanning 30 different nationalities, with a mission: reinventing local shopping worldwide.


If you want to work in a fast-growing and international environment, that’s the right place for you.

Are you ready to join us? 🚀


TO FEEL AT HOME 🛋️ IN SHOPFULLY YOU SHOULD


  • AMBITION: we aim high, designing solutions that create real value. Success is tracked with clear metrics, long-term strategies evolve with changing needs;


  • TRUTH SEEKING: openness drives progress. We ask questions, share information freely, and embrace feedback to spark fresh ideas and continuous improvement;


  • COLLABORATION: great things happen together. We value diverse voices, celebrate contributions, and create a safe space for everyone to thrive;


  • SPEED: we move fast and work smart. Focusing on what matters, we balance speed with thoughtful execution—knowing when to act quickly and when to pause for critical decisions.


WHAT YOU'LL FIND AT SHOPFULLY 🫶


🌎 A chance to grow in a fast-scaling international company;

🕶️ A dynamic, informal and inclusive work environment;

🧠 We empower you to take full ownership of your work, encouraging autonomy, flexibility and a hybrid work environment;

📚 Learning opportunities & regular feedback sessions;

🍓 Modern, central offices with fresh snacks, coffee (vegan options too!) and ergonomic setups;

🎉 Team moments that matter: offsites, team aperitivos, company parties and celebrations that bring us together beyond work;

💻We provide all the equipment you need to work effectively and set up your ideal workspace — wherever you are;

💜 Additional country-specific benefits are provided based on local contracts and practices (i.e. meal vouchers, public transports vouchers, discounts with local partners, pet & family-friendly spaces, ...) — your Recruiter will walk you through them if you move forward in the hiring process.


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR 🔍


Every day our ingestion system receives more than 100 million events from our users.


As a Machine Learning Engineer, your mission is to elevate Retail with AI-Driven Solutions.


The final goals are to transform the retail strategy with our AI-powered platform, designed to curate the finest deals and streamline product discovery for consumers, and empower global marketing efforts with automation and personalised content that resonates with shoppers.


Since you will be working in a highly collaborative environment, you will cooperate with Data and Software Engineers, Data Scientists and Product Managers.


WHAT YOU'LL DO 💪🏻


Your main responsibilities are linked to: Information Extraction and Enrichment from unstructured content, Data Platform activities (e.g., ETLs, ELTs), Multi Modal Extreme classification, Semantic Similarity in a Multi Modal setting and Recommendation systems. Here some examples:


  • Autonomy to work on data pipelines, writing SQL queries; processing data using Pandas, Polars or Spark. Following good MLOps practices to develop and implement AI models in production environments, serving +100k predictions per day;
  • Design a novel solution, from the problem to the final deployment stage; Develop AI models to process organic unstructured content such as offer images or text to extract valuable data for our users or clients;
  • Manage, work on and improve the extensive Python codebases, following the company’s internal code style and guidelines;
  • Keep up with the pace in the AI space! We tackle hard problems, we make tangible impact, so every advancement in the field, whether it is a new architecture or an off-the-shelf open source model, can bring us and our clients a ton of value! We value knowledge and curiosity, a lot.


WHAT YOU'LL NEED 🪄


  • Coding: Proficient Python knowledge; Proven experience with Pytorch, Pandas, FastAPI/Flask, HuggingFace models ecosystem. Software Engineering skills are as important as the AI-related ones;
  • MLOps : Fully autonomous in building the pipelines (data, modelling, deployment) to bring the AI solutions from experiments to production;
  • Natural Language Processing (NLP) and GenerativeAI: Advanced knowledge of neural network architectures such as Transformers, GPT and proven experience on developing projects in this area (text classification, Named entity recognition, caption generation, unstructured data extraction, etc);
  • Image and content: Solid Knowledge of neural architectures in the Computer Vision field, such as YOLO; Multi Modal Language Models or Vision Language Models. Proven experience on developing projects in this area (image classification, image-text search, image understanding, image captioning, etc);
  • Search: OpenSearch or ElasticSearch knowledge is a nice to have;
  • Recommending Systems: Good to have some proven experience (previous projects, academic works..) in building recommendation engines such as collaborative, content-based, knowledge based filtering based on custom deep learning models or available libraries like Surprise, LightFM, Implicit etc..


🌎 LOCATION: We have offices in Milan, Naples, Bologna and Cagliari but you can take advantage of our flexible hybrid mode or decide to work full-remote.


💰 SALARY RANGE: €35.000 - €50.000 gross per year


Shopfully will process your personal data for this application as indicated in the Privacy Notice pursuant to Arts. 13 and 14 of Regulation EU 2016/679 and that you can view here

Title: Talent Pool - Future Opportunities (Milan)
Description:
Location: Milan (preferred)

Language: Fluent English (Italian and other European languages are a plus)




Interested in joining Shop Circle in Italy but don’t see a role that fits right now?

This is a general application - we’d still love to hear from you.




About Shop Circle

Shop Circle is one of Europe’s fastest-growing software groups, with a portfolio of B2B tools powering over 120,000 businesses globally. We’re building a strong hub in Milan - alongside our offices in London and Sarajevo - and we’re looking for ambitious, curious minds to help shape the future of European software, especially at the intersection of software and AI.




Who should apply

We regularly hire across a range of teams, including:

Product - Product Managers, Analysts
Engineering & AI - Developers, Prompt Engineers
Go-to-Market (GTM) - Sales, Sales Engineers
Value Creation - Strategy, Operations, AI Implementation
Finance & M&A - FP&A, Analysts, Associates, Deal Support

Or anyone who believes they can help us scale smarter and faster.




Why join Shop Circle in Milan

Work on software used by 120,000+ businesses worldwide
Help design and implement AI-powered product features and internal tools
Join a fast-growing Milan-based team driving product and tech innovation
Be part of an ambitious, international, execution-first culture
Learn, grow, and make a measurable impact on the future of B2B software in Europe




Ready to connect?

Submit your CV and tell us a bit about what drives you. We’ll be in touch when the right opportunity opens up.

Title: Doers
Description:
Milan (IT)

Octopus Energy Italia 🇮🇹 – Candidatura Spontanea /

Full-time /

Hybrid



Benvenuti nel futuro dell’energia!

La missione di Octopus Energy è rendere l’energia rinnovabile accessibile a tutti.

Grazie alla tecnologia, stiamo guidando la rivoluzione energetica a livello globale, offrendo energia pulita a prezzi convenienti e un servizio clienti sbalorditivo.

Se non ti piacciono le sfide non inviarci la tua candidatura ;)

In Octopus Energy non amiamo la burocrazia, le regole troppo stringenti e le offerte commerciali poco chiare.

Vogliamo rivoluzionare il mercato energetico italiano. Per farlo, siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate, che condividano i nostri stessi valori.

Se hai a cuore il futuro del nostro pianeta e vuoi aiutarci a migliorare il settore energetico, unisciti al nostro team!

La nostra missione è trasformare le idee in realtà e creare soluzioni innovative che fanno la differenza.

Siamo alla ricerca di persone intraprendenti, che non hanno paura di sporcarsi le mani e che amano fare, inventare e costruire. Se sei una persona pratica e hai la passione per la creatività e l'innovazione, allora sei nel posto giusto!

In un ambiente dinamico e senza burocrazia, potrai dare sfogo alla tua curiosità, sperimentare nuove idee e vedere i tuoi progetti prendere vita. Non ci piacciono le regole rigide, preferiamo l'azione e la concretezza.

Cosa sai fare:


Dimostrata abilità nel realizzare progetti concreti e innovativi.
Capacità di prendere in mano qualcosa di destrutturato e trasformarlo in un progetto organizzato.
Competenze nell'uso di sistemi low-code per sviluppare soluzioni rapide ed efficaci.
Abilità di gestione dei progetti (project management skills), inclusa la pianificazione, l'esecuzione e il monitoraggio.
Esperienza nel risolvere problemi in modo creativo e pratico.
Attitudine a lavorare in un ambiente dinamico e in continua evoluzione.
Forte orientamento ai risultati e alla qualità.
Capacità di collaborare con team interdisciplinari per sviluppare soluzioni integrate.
Abilità nella raccolta e analisi dei dati per migliorare i processi e le soluzioni.



Inviaci il tuo CV e raccontaci qualcosa di te e delle tue passioni. Se questo annuncio ti rispecchia, non vediamo l'ora di conoscere te e le tue idee!

Title: Data Scientist (Cat. Protette - L. 68/99)
Description:
Il Ruolo

Herzum è alla ricerca di un Data Scientist appartenente alle Categorie Protette (L. 68/99) che si unisca al nostro team e fornisca supporto ad uno dei nostri Clienti nello sviluppo e nell’ottimizzazione di soluzioni software basate su AI generativa, con particolare attenzione al prompt engineering e all’integrazione di modelli LLM.

Responsabilità:


Progettare, sviluppare e testare prompt avanzati per modelli di AI generativa, ottimizzando le risposte in base ai diversi contesti aziendali.
Analizzare e migliorare il comportamento dei modelli LLM attraverso attività di testing e valutazioni qualitative.
Collaborare alla progettazione di applicazioni basate su AI generativa, dalla prototipazione al deployment in ambienti di produzione.
Scrivere codice Python pulito e manutenibile.
Sviluppare e mantenere sistemi backend e API per l’integrazione fluida dei modelli LLM nelle applicazioni.



Requisiti:


Esperienza nello sviluppo in Python, con focus su automazione dei flussi di dati e supporto a sistemi di AI generativa.
Conoscenza approfondita dei principali modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLM) come GPT, Claude, BERT o equivalenti, e delle loro applicazioni pratiche.
Esperienza nell’uso di framework per AI generativa, in particolare LangChain, per orchestrare interazioni tra modelli, strumenti e fonti dati.
Comprensione solida di elaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP), machine learning, strutture dati, algoritmi e principi di progettazione software.
Esperienza nello sviluppo di API RESTful e nell’integrazione di servizi AI in ambienti backend.
Attitudine al problem solving.
Flessibilità e adattabilità a contesti dinamici.



Informazioni aggiuntive:


Modalità di lavoro: full remote
Start: settembre 2025



Unisciti a noi! Entra a far parte di un team che vive di innovazione, crede nel talento e punta all’eccellenza. Il tuo prossimo passo di carriera inizia qui.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a persone tutelate dalla Legge n.68 del 12 marzo 1999: Collocamento mirato delle persone con disabilità.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77 e 125/91) e a persone di tutte le età e nazionalità (D.Lgs. 215/03 e 216/03).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a medior or senior Data Scientist with a minimum of 3 years' experience and a proven track record in developing generative AI applications.




As a Data Scientist, you will need to have expertise in various aspects of Machine Learning. This role offers the opportunity to apply and enhance your skills across multiple domains:







Tackle various business challenges by creating AI applications (virtual assistant, …) aimed at enhancing client experiences, empowering employees with superior tools, and automating and optimizing internal processes.
Utilize a range of analytical methodologies (generative AI and predictive AI), including GenAI techniques & methodologies : Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning, speech-to-text, agentic applications, image generation and interpretation, and classical statistical/machine learning techniques. While we don't expect you to be an expert in all areas, you should possess strong expertise in core technologies and the ability to learn new methods as required.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI applications in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Communicate the fruits of your work directly to the top management.
Access one of the richest volumes of varied data in the market and apply your skills to it.
Evolve in an environment where innovation and lean processes are praised, straight-forward communication is encouraged, and peers understand the meaning of team up.
Work with a team of colleagues in an Agile organization who are ready to collaborate and to share their experience.







Language requirements

DUTCH or FRENCH + English




You have at least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics or engineering.




Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of analytics are also encouraged to apply




You have at least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and Analytics.




Technical experience mandatory

Python, deep learning and pre-trained models




Preferable Domino, git, genAI framework : langchain, haystack, ...







Soft skills Team player




Business oriented

Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude

Good Communication and Influencing skills

Good analytical and synthesis skills

Autonomy, commitment and perseverance

Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment

Show more

Title: Expert in AI/ML/NLP (SNS02314)
HTML:
Job Description

Following tasks will be performed by the external service provider:

  • Design the IT architecture for solutions in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and implement PoCs

such as in the ChatBot / RAG field;

  • Analyse data assets & business processes;
  • Analyse risk-level of existing LLMs implemented in few of IT systems;
  • Industrialise PoCs once they have proven to bring value-added, in close collaboration with

other engineers members.

  • Train custom machine learning (e.g. RAG based) based on structured and unstructured data;
  • Interact with the local data correspondent, the digital transformation officer, and other IT

stakeholders;

  • Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis;
  • Follow the progress of implementation of corporate AI initiatives and identify

opportunities to leverage the use of them;

  • Contribute to the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and derive the IT

requirements.

Knowledge And Skills

Following knowledge & skills are mandatory for the performance of the above listed tasks:

Knowledge

  • Very good knowledge of Python. Knowledge of R and its NLP/ML libraries is a plus (e.g.:

SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas…);

  • Very good knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as SVM, Neural

Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;

  • Very good knowledge of Data Management;
  • Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
  • Good knowledge of Linux;
  • Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software

development methodologies;

  • Good knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB;
  • Good knowledge of graph DB and triples;
  • Good knowledge of query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc.;
  • Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.;
  • Experience with data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data

lakes; Skills:

  • Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
  • Ability to understand, speak and write English, optionally French as an additional asset;
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills,
  • Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously;
  • Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering;
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.;
  • Good

scripting and programming skills;

  • Data-driven mindset.

Specific Expertise

Any experience in the field of RAG processing will be considered as an asset.

Hiring Team Member

Akesh Raj

Talent Acquisition Lead

  • LinkedIn
  • Mail

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are currently looking for a “Data Scientist” to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.

This position requires a maximum of 5 days per month at client offices. However, teleworking must take place within 2 hours of Brussels.

Responsabilities


Coordination and review of policy units' business needs
Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units' business needs
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers
Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks
Creating, designing and developing data models
Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting
Assessment and quality control of data
Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders
Management and processing of data
Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available
Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI
Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed


Technical skills


Data Analytics techniques and tools
Power BI (including Power Query)
Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other Business Intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS...), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory...)
SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores
Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems


Profile


Bachelor's degree minimum
English fluent
Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving


Why cronos group?

We'll propose you


An attractive salary package
A good work-life balance environment
The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
A good job in a friendly place


If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

Title: AI/ML Developer
Description:
About The Opportunity

We operate in the staffing and talent acquisition sector, specialising in placing top-tier AI/ML professionals with leading technology companies across the European Union. As remote work continues to reshape the tech landscape, you’ll join a network of skilled developers who drive machine learning and artificial intelligence initiatives, delivering scalable, production-grade solutions for clients spanning diverse industries.

Role & Responsibilities


Design, build and optimise end-to-end machine learning pipelines, including data ingestion, preprocessing, model training, evaluation and deployment.
Implement scalable AI/ML solutions using Python and frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch to solve complex business challenges.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers and product teams to integrate ML models into production systems and APIs.
Monitor model performance in production, troubleshoot issues and iterate on algorithms to ensure high reliability, low latency and data integrity.
Develop and maintain RESTful services or microservices for model inference using Flask, FastAPI or similar frameworks.
Document best practices, contribute to architecture reviews and mentor peers on coding standards, testing and observability.


Skills & Qualifications

Must-Have


3+ years of hands-on experience building and deploying AI/ML models in a production environment.
Proficiency in Python with core libraries (NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn).
Solid experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms.
Experience with containerisation tools (Docker) and deploying models via RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with version control (Git) and CI/CD pipelines.


Preferred


Experience with MLOps platforms (MLflow, Kubeflow) and automated retraining workflows.
Background in NLP or computer vision projects and relevant libraries.
Exposure to Kubernetes or serverless architectures for scalable inference.
Knowledge of data engineering frameworks (Airflow, Spark) for large-scale ETL.


Benefits & Culture Highlights


Fully remote position with flexible working hours across the European Union.
Access to continuous learning resources, AI/ML communities and industry conferences.
A collaborative, innovation-driven culture with regular knowledge-sharing sessions and hackathons.


Skills: ml,algorithms,pytorch,scikit-learn,restful apis,numpy,ci/cd,ai ethics,pandas,docker,tensorflow,machine learning,learning,python,git,ai/ml,data,pipelines
Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
About

Meer dan 2000 professionals omarmen bij Smals elke dag de toekomst door zich in te zetten voor ICT for Society. Hoogtechnologische ICT-systemen zorgen voor meer efficiëntie in de belangrijke sociale verantwoordelijkheidsdomeinen van onze klanten zoals werk, gezin en gezondheid. Het eHealthplatform, een beveiligd uitwisselingsplatform voor medische informatie, zal papieren doktersbriefjes en doktersvoorschriften op termijn overbodig maken. Daarnaast zorgt de ICT-service Dimona er voor dat de RSZ de sociale bescherming van 4 miljoen werknemers snel kan laten evolueren, ongeacht hoe snel ze van job veranderen. Handig? Jazeker, en uitdagend ook. Functieomschrijving Als Data Science Analyst sta je in voor het aanleveren van datagedreven oplossingen in een BI-team van 9 personen.

Je ontwerpt en bouwt een modulair en toekomstgericht machine learningframework op basis van best practices en coacht collega’s bij het gebruik ervan. Je levert een schaalbaar en overdraagbaar framework op binnen een on-premise omgeving, met het oog op een migratie naar een cloudomgeving.

Daarnaast ontwikkel en pas je machine learningmodellen toe. Je analyseert en bereidt data voor. Zo vertaal je businessvragen naar datagedreven oplossingen en train je voorspellende modellen die je ook in productie brengt. Je automatiseert het volledige proces, visualiseert en presenteert de resultaten en optimaliseert continu de modellen. Zo zorg je ervoor dat jouw modellen waardevolle en bruikbare inzichten opleveren. Profiel Je behaalde een Masterdiploma of je kan een gelijkwaardig niveau aantonen door relevante ervaring. Je hebt minstens 5 jaar ervaring in een gelijkaardig domein.

Je hebt een grondige kennis van machine learningtechnieken. Tevens heb je een goede statistische achtergrond met een actieve kennis van analytische modellen.

Je bent eveneens bedreven in SQL en Python.

Je hebt een aantoonbare ervaring met on-premise (zoals KNIME) en clouddatascienceplatformen (zoals Microsoft Fabric).

Ook het presenteren van bevindingen aan de business is je vertrouwd.

Ervaring met Devops (of soortgelijke applicaties), Oracle databases, Microsoft SQL databases is een pluspunt.

Met een focus op innovatie neem je tevens een proactieve ingesteldheid aan. Je houdt van uitdagingen en toont je resultaatgericht.

Je bent analytisch ingesteld en kan daarbij onderbouwde beslissingen nemen. Als teamplayer draag je actief bij aan een positieve samenwerking.

Daarnaast beschik je over sterke communicatieve en presentatievaardigheden.

Tot slot heb je een actieve kennis van het Frans. Aanbod


Je krijgt een gevarieerde, uitdagende en maatschappelijk relevante job waarbij je bijdraagt aan IT-oplossingen die een belangrijke rol spelen in de samenleving. Onze slogan 'ICT for society' weerspiegelt dit perfect.
Zoek je een goede balans tussen werk en privéleven? Geniet van flexibele werkuren en maak gebruik van ons zeer uitgebreid telewerkbeleid.
We bieden ruime interne en externe opleidingsmogelijkheden, waardoor je je technische skills en persoonlijke vaardigheden voortdurend kunt aanscherpen.
We bieden je een competitief salaris, aangevuld met extralegale voordelen zoals hospitalisatieverzekering, aanvullend pensioenplan, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques,…


IT-functies kunnen rekenen op een mobiliteitsbudget met de keuze voor een bedrijfswagen en/of terugbetaling openbaar vervoer. Onder bepaalde voorwaarden kan je dit budget zelfs gebruiken voor de betaling van je huur of hypothecaire lening.


Via ons 'Benefits at Work'-platform geniet je van mooie kortingen op mode, elektronica, daguitstappen, vakantieverblijven, …
We voeren een gelijkekansenbeleid en vinden o.a. equal pay belangrijk.


Nice-to-have skills


DevOps
Machine Learning
Oracle Databases
Python
SQL
Knime
Brussels, Brussels-Capital Region, Belgium


Work experience


Data Engineer
Data Scientist


Languages


English
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
B.E.S. (Business and Engineering Solutions) is looking for a Data Scientist to coordinate, define and execute the data activities in the automotive sector.







Your responsabilities :

You implement feature engineering techniques to extract main features from events, manoeuvres, and trips,
You support study of driver behaviour based on time series big data and aggregated demographics,
You support Link Driver Behaviour comprehensive groups with market and persona data,
You provide support in the application of data science methods in study cases,
You analyse customer survey data and market data,




Your profile :

You have a Master degree,
You are fluent in English (written and spoken), French is a real asset,
You have 1 year of experience (internship, apprenticeship) in data,
You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,
You have knowldege in Python,
You have experience with big data,
You can work autonomously.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances OR a VIE!
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Company Description

Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.

Job Description

They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.

ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:


Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment


Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.

Additional Information

Technical Experience Required:


Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql
Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools
Show more

  • Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
  • Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment

Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.

Additional Information

Technical Experience Required:

  • Containerization / virtualisation
  • AI platforms & IDEs
  • CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
  • Code, model & data versioning
  • Python
  • Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
  • postgresql
  • Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
  • Model compression techniques
  • ELT / ETL tools
  • Big data tools (Spark)
  • Data flow processing
  • Data visualization tools

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are currently looking for a “Data Scientist” to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.


This position requires a maximum of 5 days per month at client offices. However, teleworking must take place within 2 hours of Brussels.


Responsabilities:

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units’ business needs;
  • Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed.


Technical skills:

  • Data Analytics techniques and tools.
  • Power BI (including Power Query).
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other business intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory…).
  • SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
  • Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems.


Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree minimum
  • English fluent
  • Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving.


Why Cronos Group?

We’ll propose you:

  • An attractive salary package
  • A good work-life balance environment
  • The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
  • A good job in a friendly place

If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions – including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection – all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of €2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




The Data Scientist in Advisory & Professional Services plays a key role in designing and implementing generative AI solutions that solve real business problems. Working closely with senior data scientists, consultants, and engineers, this role supports the development of prototypes, PoVs, and client-facing solutions using state-of-the-art AI models, agentic frameworks and techniques. The ideal candidate combines hands-on technical ability with curiosity and the drive to create business value through data.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Technical Delivery:

Assist in designing and building Gen AI prototypes using LLMs, embeddings, RAG pipelines, and fine-tuning techniques.
Develop and test agentic workflows using frameworks like LangChain Agents, CrewAI, AutoGen, or Databricks Mosaic AI
Support feature engineering, evaluation, and testing of models in collaboration with architects and engineers.
Create clean, reusable code and Jupyter notebooks that align with internal quality and documentation standards.




Client Collaboration:

Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and technical validation phases.
Translate client needs into tractable data science tasks and communicate results clearly.
Collaborate with squads to continuously refine agent behavior, planning strategies, and tool integrations
Support the presentation of prototypes and findings in pre-sales and advisory engagements.




Reusability & Innovation:

Contribute to internal libraries, prompt collections, evaluation frameworks, and demo environments.
Help maintain Gen AI accelerator kits and continuously refine based on project experience.




Governance & Compliance:

Apply responsible AI principles including explainability, fairness, and auditability in project work.
Ensure alignment with the AI governance framework, especially regarding EU AI Act and data protection.




REQUIREMENTS

3–5 years of experience in data science or applied machine learning, preferably in a consulting or client-facing environment.
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt engineering.
Skilled in Python and ML libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, scikit-learn, Pandas, and Jupyter.
Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools like MLflow, DVC, or cloud-based model deployment (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable working with REST APIs, event-driven architectures, and integrating external tools into agent workflows
A team player with an appetite for learning, co-creation, and working in multidisciplinary squads.
Awareness of ethical AI, responsible AI practices, and data privacy guidelines.
Fluent English
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyse raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, Power BI)

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI/ML Engineer




Location: Remote (Europe based)




Industry: Life Sciences Quality Management SaaS




About Us: We are a SaaS company specializing in innovative quality management systems (QMS) tailored for the life sciences sector. Our mission is to ensure compliance, enhance quality processes, and improve operational efficiency through cutting-edge technology and AI-driven analytics.




Role Overview: We are seeking an experienced AI/ML Engineer to join our AI & Data Analytics team. You will lead and contribute to impactful projects that leverage advanced machine learning, analytics techniques, and large language models (LLMs). Your primary responsibility will involve designing, developing, and deploying AI-powered features to enhance our platform's capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models, including applications involving large language models (LLMs), to enhance product capabilities.
Analyze structured and unstructured data, including text-based documents and event records.
Conduct data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Utilize semantic search techniques, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) methods, and advanced LLM-based frameworks.
Collaborate with product managers, software developers, and quality assurance teams to integrate and deploy AI features.
Monitor, evaluate, and optimize model performance continuously.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields.
3+ years of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or related roles.
Proficiency in Python and key libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, and NumPy.
Experience working with LLMs.
Experience in semantic search, document retrieval, text analytics, and prompt engineering.
Robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience processing regulatory documents, compliance texts, or technical documentation in regulated industries
Experience fine-tuning LLMs.
Prior experience within SaaS or life sciences sectors.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and machine learning deployment processes.
Knowledge of vector databases and modern AI application architectures.




Soft Skills:

Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
Ability to translate complex technical solutions into understandable insights for business stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, attention to detail, and commitment to quality outcomes.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, innovative environment with opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer | Brussels (Hybrid) | 12-Month Contract | €500-€750pd




Location: Brussels – 50% Remote

Duration: 12 months

Languages: English (mandatory), Dutch/French (a plus)




Are you a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer passionate about production-grade AI solutions?

We’re partnering with a leading financial institution in Brussels looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their AI & Analytics team.




You’ll play a key role in developing, deploying, and monitoring ML services, bridging the gap between Data Science and IT production teams.




Skill & Responsibilities:

4+ years of relevant ML engineering experience
Design ML pipelines with production-readiness in mind
Automate model deployment using CI/CD (GitLab-CI)
Ensure end-to-end ML lifecycle: data ingestion, monitoring, and retraining
Collaborate with Data Scientists & IT teams to scale models in real environments
Tech Stack: Spark, Python, PostgreSQL, Docker, GitLab-CI
AI/ML platforms, model & code versioning, package management
Bonus: Spark, ETL tools, data visualisation, model compression




If you are interested in the Machine Learning Engineer position, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible.

Should be comfortable taking on data analyst tasks if needed, and to interface with business
Ability to work independently, taking ownership and being a team player are key requirements
Knowledge of ML and LLMs and MLops/pipelines will be a big plus




Required Skills:

Expert-level Python (Full stack)
Advanced SQL
Strong experience in data science and data modelling
Experience with Azure cloud services
Good working knowledge of LLMs and Generative AI
Familiar with ML workflows, pipelines, and MLOps

Location: Europe (100% Remote)

Duration: 6+ months renewable


Description :

We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to support our client's data science team. The ideal candidate is highly skilled in Python, SQL, and Azure, and has practical experience working with LLMs, machine learning, and modern data architectures.

  • Familiar with ML workflows, pipelines, and MLOps

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
A major enterprise in the financial sector is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join its cross-functional AI & Data team. This role focuses on enabling production-ready Machine Learning pipelines and ensuring seamless integration of ML solutions into enterprise-grade systems.

You'll bridge the gap between Data Science and IT Operations by ensuring that deployed ML models are scalable, reliable, and continuously monitored, contributing to both the technical and business performance of AI-driven services.

Key responsibilities

Collaborate with Data Scientists to define and build ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Design and implement automation for ML pipelines, including containerization (Docker/VM), testing (unit/integration/regression), and deployment using CI/CD tools.
Support the integration of AI services using existing industrial tools and platforms.
Work with IT Production teams to parameterize and maintain ML environments.
Ensure model reliability, retraining strategies, and monitoring across technical and business dimensions.

Required skills & experience

Professional experience

Minimum of 4 years of experience in a similar role
Prior experience working within Agile methodologies

Technical expertise (mandatory)

Containerization & Virtualization (Docker, VM)
CI/CD tooling (GitLab CI or equivalent)
AI platforms and development environments (IDEs)
Version Control (code, model, data)
Python programming
Dependency/package management
PostgreSQL

Technical expertise (nice to have)

Integration across varied tech stacks (e.g., distributed systems, mainframes)
Model optimization (e.g., compression techniques)
ELT / ETL pipelines
Big Data processing tools (e.g., Spark)
Data visualization and real-time data flow tools

Soft skills

Strong communication (written and oral)
Results-oriented with attention to detail
Creative problem-solver and continuous learner
Efficient, proactive, and adaptable
Team player who thrives in a dynamic, evolving environment

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist – Grid Optimization & AI Compliance

About Remobi:

We are Remobi – we empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high-performing, high-quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams. Join our Remobi community to gain access to meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate!




Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: Initial 12 Months




Position Summary:

We’re hiring a Data Scientist to build and deploy reinforcement learning (RL) models that optimize real-time control of energy grid systems. This role focuses on developing scalable, responsible AI solutions that reduce emissions, support compliance, and improve operational efficiency. You’ll work with cutting-edge tools like Grid2Op, L2RPN, and ICTE, integrating your work into cloud-native environments with Python and AWS.

This position suits someone passionate about sustainability, operational AI, and solving complex, real-world challenges.




Responsibilities:

Design, train, and deploy RL models to optimize real-time grid operations.
Use open-source grid simulation platforms (Grid2Op, L2RPN, ICTE) to develop and validate models.
Ensure models comply with regulatory and sustainability standards for AI systems.
Deploy and scale models using AWS services such as SageMaker, Lambda, and S3.
Collaborate with engineers, compliance teams, and energy operations specialists.
Translate technical insights into clear communications for varied stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Proven experience with Reinforcement Learning, ideally applied to physical or control systems.
Advanced Python programming and model deployment skills.
Hands-on use of tools like Grid2Op, L2RPN, ICTE, or similar simulation environments.
Experience deploying models on AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, S3).
Familiarity with smart grid technologies or energy systems is a plus.
Understanding of AI governance, sustainability metrics, or regulatory frameworks.
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or related technical discipline.




If you’re interested in this role or know someone who might be a great fit, feel free to apply or get in touch!

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Publication date: July 28, 2025

Brussels

Contract open-end

Turning data into intelligent solutions and algorithms into real-world impact.

As an AI/ML Engineer, you bring AI to life : designing, building and optimizing intelligent applications that truly serve end users. You develop GenAI features, craft robust backend systems and APIs and collaborate with data and ML engineers to scale impactful models. You make sure our AI runs smoothly, stays cost-efficient and keep pushing the boundaries by experimenting with new capabilities that shape our customer facing gen AI roadmap.

What you’ll do


Using LLMs like OpenAI or open-source models, you build GenAI agents, workflows and backend services.
You align AI capabilities with real business value and user needs.
You translate customer pain points into smart, scalable technical solutions.
Implementing guardrails and fallback mechanisms, you optimize for cost, speed and stability.
You collaborate with Data/ML Engineers, frontend, QA and product teams across the full AI lifecycle.
You share best practices through internal libraries, design patterns and Luminus’ Data & AI Community.


What you bring


You have strong programming skills in Python and experience with frameworks like FastAPI or Flask.
You bring hands-on experience with LLMs, prompt engineering and model evaluation.
You’re comfortable working with APIs, cloud services and DevOps pipelines.
You have a sharp analytical mindset with a focus on robustness and maintainability.
You communicate clearly and collaborate with ease.
You’re fluent in English and either Dutch or French.


Why join us


You will be part of a company that drives key changes towards a more sustainable and energy-efficient society.
You join a team of motivated people with diverse and strong skills, offering you real opportunities to grow and learn.
You take ownership of projects and make a real impact by defining not just how we do things, but also what we should do.
You work from home or in a Luminus hub. Nine-to-five, or not? There are options to make your schedule work for you.


What you’ll get in return?

The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:


Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
Insurance & social benefits: Group insurance and hospitalization coverage for the entire family. Additional reimbursement for healthcare and pharmaceutical costs.
Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choices: you can choose between a company car or mobility budget.
Internet & communication: Home internet covered, reimbursement for a personal mobile device with a phone subscription.
Home Office: A fully-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set-up.
Exclusive discounts: 30% off gas and electricity after six months, discounts on energy-saving services (e.g., solar panels, heat pumps) and reduced prices on top brands, amusement parks, festivals and more.


Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Luminus values e.v.e.r.y individual.

Are you looking for a workplace where you can truly be yourself, where you feel respected, supported regardless of your background, identity and unique story? Then you’ve come to the right place. Diversity equity and inclusion are not empty words for us — we grant that everyone can flourish and feel valued, so let’s build it together!

What does that mean in practice?

Do you have specific needs or require adjustments during the recruitment process or once you are hired? Let’s discuss about it and we’ll do our best to find a solution. We can also discuss if you want to work at 80% or 100%.

Together we make the difference

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Speech Recognition Engineer Role - Brussels




My client are building cutting-edge voice technology track and monitor customer voice to develop insights to use in future use cases. From real-time transcription to multilingual voice assistants, my client design intelligent systems that inform future practices.




Design, build, and optimize end-to-end speech-to-text (STT) and natural language understanding (NLU) pipelines.
Fine-tune and evaluate ASR models (e.g. Wav2Vec 2.0, Whisper, Kaldi, or DeepSpeech).
Implement speaker diarization, noise reduction, and language modeling techniques.
Collaborate with product teams to integrate real-time transcription and voice services into production systems.
Drive innovation in voice AI with research and experimentation in neural acoustic modeling, beam search decoding, or self-supervised learning.




Must have experience with Speech Recognition and/or Speech-to-Text data




The role is Brussels based
Project is planned to last 3 years
Hybrid working
Large client with real world impact




If this role is of interest to you, please apply here I will give you a call and get your interview booked in ASAP!
