Title: AI/ML Engineer
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI/ML Engineer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Define & maintain an architectural vision & overview of the project's landscape and registry of design related artefacts;
  • Analyse gen AI architecture for consistency, completeness, accuracy and reasonableness;
  • Oversee, monitor and report on vendor and contractor technical implementation activities in the project;
  • Establish quality control mechanisms and implement actions to maintain architectural consistency across the client's application landscape.


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 13 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 10 years of experience in Solution Architecture and System Design for large-scale IT projects, ideally in EU organisations;
  • Experience with Data Science and Machine Learning principles;
  • Experience with AI frameworks such as Haystack, Langchain, etc.;
  • Experience in software requirements engineering, with an ability to translate complex stakeholder requirements into solutions and detailed technical specifications;
  • Experience in programming languages such as Python, along with experience in using development tools like GIT, GitLab, Jira, Confluence, etc.;
  • Experience with database management systems (PostgreSQL, etc.) and search engines (Elastic Search, etc.);
  • Good knowledge of quality procedures and their application in the software development life cycle;
  • Good knowledge of information systems governance;
  • Good knowledge of cloud technologies;
  • Knowledge of standard web technologies like API driven architecture, Single Page Application, Backend-for-Frontend, etc.;
  • Any certification in the following area is required: Data Science and Machine Learning, especially related to AI/ML with Python;
  • Excellent command of the English language.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18932/08/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.


EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist.
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.

HTML:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
💼Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

🌐Language: Fluent English; Dutch OR French is required.

📄 Work Authorization: Valid work permit or combined permit to work in Belgium is required

🔥Keywords: Python, Machine Learning , IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code) , AI platforms




🧠 About the Role

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science and production engineering. You’ll play a key role in transforming ML models into scalable, production-ready solutions that deliver real business value.

🎯 What You’ll Do

Collaborate with Data Scientists to design ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Build and automate ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD tools.
Deploy, monitor, and retrain models in production environments.
Ensure robust data flow, versioning, and model performance tracking.
Support IT teams in configuring and maintaining production infrastructure.
Promote best practices in ML engineering across teams.

🛠️ What You Bring

Must-Have Technical Skills
Python programming
Containerization (Docker, VMs)
CI/CD (e.g., GitLab CI)
AI platforms & IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code)
Code, model & data versioning
PostgreSQL
Dependency and package management

Nice-to-Have

Experience with distributed systems or mainframe integration
Model compression techniques
ETL/ELT tools
Big Data tools (e.g., Spark)
Data flow processing and visualization tools

💼 Business & Soft Skills

Agile methodology experience
Strong communication (written & verbal)
Detail-oriented and results-driven
Creative problem solver
Continuous learner with a proactive mindset
Open to feedback and innovation.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – 12 Months

Location: Brussels Hybrid (50% on-site) | Sector: Banking | Start: ASAP




A major banking institution is seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to help industrialize AI solutions by developing production-grade pipelines and ensuring seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.




Role Overview

You’ll collaborate with data scientists and IT teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and automated ML services. This includes designing infrastructure-aware solutions, automating workflows, and ensuring robust integration with existing systems.




Key Responsibilities

Co-design ML solutions with data scientists, taking production constraints into account
Automate and deploy ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD best practices
Implement model and data versioning, testing frameworks, and performance monitoring
Act as a technical bridge between AI teams and IT operations for deployment and maintenance
Ensure models are monitored, retrained when needed, and integrated with business metrics




Mandatory Skills

4+ years of experience in ML engineering or related roles
Strong Python development and CI/CD experience (e.g., GitLab CI)
Hands-on with containerization/virtualization (Docker, VMs)
Proficient in data/model/code versioning and dependency management
Experience with PostgreSQL and related tooling
Fluent in English; working proficiency in French or Dutch is a PLUS
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and collaborative delivery




Nice to Have

Familiarity with Spark, ETL/ELT workflows, and data flow orchestration
Knowledge of legacy systems integration and hybrid infrastructure
Experience with model compression, performance tuning, or data visualization tools

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
Description:
📊 We’re Hiring: Data Scientist / Data Analyst (Remote – Belgium Based)

Location: Fully remote (aligned to Belgian business hours—CET/CEST)

Role Type: Full-time / Contract / Freelance

Experience Level: Entry to Mid-Level (1–5+ years in analytics or data science roles)

Sector Focus: E‑commerce · SaaS · Financial Services · Digital Agencies · EdTech · CRM/Operations

🎯 Role Overview

You’ll gather and analyze complex data sets to inform business decisions, build dashboards, and deliver actionable insights. As a Data Scientist or Data Analyst, you may also model and automate advanced analytics workflows, depending on specialization. Your work will directly shape product, growth, and strategy across teams.

📌 Core Responsibilities
Data Analyst Track
Clean and structure multi-source data
Build dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Perform ad-hoc analyses (cohort, segmentation, campaign, operational)
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, Finance, or Ops to inform decisions
Validate data integrity and enhance reporting processes
Data Scientist Track (if applicable)
Develop predictive models or ML workflows
Automate analytical pipelines and apply advanced statistical techniques for business impact
Present findings and model outcomes to internal stakeholders
✅ Ideal Candidate Profile
Data Analyst: 1–5+ years in BI, analytics, or data reporting roles
Data Scientist: 2–5+ years in modeling, engineering, or advanced analytics
Proficiency with SQL, Excel, Python/R (for Data Scientist track), and BI tools
Strong analytical thinking and clear communication
Fluent in English (knowledge of Dutch or French is an asset, not required)
Comfortable collaborating virtually within Belgian working hours

HTML:
📊 We’re Hiring: Data Scientist / Data Analyst (Remote – Belgium Based)

Location: Fully remote (aligned to Belgian business hours—CET/CEST)

Role Type: Full-time / Contract / Freelance

Experience Level: Entry to Mid-Level (1–5+ years in analytics or data science roles)

Sector Focus: E‑commerce · SaaS · Financial Services · Digital Agencies · EdTech · CRM/Operations

🎯 Role Overview

You’ll gather and analyze complex data sets to inform business decisions, build dashboards, and deliver actionable insights. As a Data Scientist or Data Analyst, you may also model and automate advanced analytics workflows, depending on specialization. Your work will directly shape product, growth, and strategy across teams.

📌 Core Responsibilities
  • Data Analyst Track
  • Clean and structure multi-source data
  • Build dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
  • Perform ad-hoc analyses (cohort, segmentation, campaign, operational)
  • Collaborate with Marketing, Product, Finance, or Ops to inform decisions
  • Validate data integrity and enhance reporting processes
  • Data Scientist Track (if applicable)
  • Develop predictive models or ML workflows
  • Automate analytical pipelines and apply advanced statistical techniques for business impact
  • Present findings and model outcomes to internal stakeholders
✅ Ideal Candidate Profile
  • Data Analyst: 1–5+ years in BI, analytics, or data reporting roles
  • Data Scientist: 2–5+ years in modeling, engineering, or advanced analytics
  • Proficiency with SQL, Excel, Python/R (for Data Scientist track), and BI tools
  • Strong analytical thinking and clear communication
  • Fluent in English (knowledge of Dutch or French is an asset, not required)
  • Comfortable collaborating virtually within Belgian working hours

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are actively looking for several AI Engineers to join our client.




What You Will Do

Architect and implement scalable AI and data-driven solutions (spanning ML pipelines, NLP, computer vision, and analytics)
Work end-to-end on data strategy: from ingestion/ETL to model deployment/inference
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify AI opportunities and deliver prototypes in Agile sprints
Ensure robust data quality, governance, compliance, and model explainability (XAI/ethics)
Maintain and optimize cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) for ML/AI workloads
Mentor junior engineers and share best practices in code, data, ethics, and AI tooling




What You Bring

5+ years in software engineering or data engineering, including 3+ years in AI/ML model development
Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow / PyTorch), SQL, and cloud computing
Experience with LLM, AI ethics, or explainable AI
Advanced knowledge of data pipelines / ETL, CI/CD, and MLOps best practices
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience in finance or enterprise sectors is a major plus




Interested? Apply immediately!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Jouw profiel:




Je bent afgestudeerd als master in de ingenieurswetenschappen (bij voorkeur Burgerlijk ingenieur): Computerwetenschappen of Informatica en je hebt minimaal drie jaar ervaring als Data Scientist..

Je hebt kennis van R, Python (waaronder TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy) en Exploratory Data Analysis.

Je hebt een affiniteit voor verschillende machine learning-algoritmen, zoals regressie, classificatie, clustering en deep learning.

Een eerste ervaring met Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau en met bigdata-technologieën (Hadoop, Spark of NoSQL-databases) is een plus.

Je bent vertrouwd met databases en querytalen zoals SQL om gegevens efficiënt te kunnen opslaan en ophalen.

Je bent gepassioneerd door technologie en volgt de laatste trends op de voet (zoals augmented analytics, data fabric, NLU/NLP, enzovoort).

Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands.

Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs B.




Wat wij bieden:




Een inspirerende werkomgeving met leuke collega's met een sterke focus op sfeer en teamspirit.

Een kans je te bewijzen in een toekomstgericht knelpuntberoep en hierin professionele expertise op te bouwen.

Een persoonlijk carrièreplan en transparant opleidingsprogramma dat regelmatig besproken wordt met onze talent manager en dat je voorbereidt op de uitdaging van een sleutelpositie binnen onze klantenorganisatie.

Een goede balans tussen werk en privéleven met thuiswerkmogelijkheden.

Een full-option loonpakket, inclusief tal van extralegale voordelen zoals verzekeringen, netto vergoedingen, extra vakantiedagen, enz.

Een premium bedrijfswagenpark in slimme combinatie met andere duurzame faciliteiten.




In geval van interesse, stuur ons een berichtje op jobs@rp-one.eu.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application! 

You are fully convinced that data science isn’t a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence. 

Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who has:


A master’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer’s business context and challenges.
You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.


What we can offer:


A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimise rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimising simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such LangChain, LangGraph.
Backend development experience with frameworks like FastAPI, Django, or Flask.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with databases, API design, and microservices architecture.
Understanding of MLOps practices, model versioning, and CI/CD for ML systems.




What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.





Job Description



They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.







ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:



Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment



Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.





Additional Information



Technical Experience Required:



Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql





Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist & AI (€50k-€80k) - EU
Description:
Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,500,000 users come true!




We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals (with 0 to 3 years of experience) who aspire to join our team across Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a relevant role becomes available and your profile matches our requirements.




For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EU Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work in one of our offices or fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.




We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.

--




Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.
Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.
Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.




--




What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:

Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.
Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.
Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.

--




Who We Are:

Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.




We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.




Our community includes over 1,500,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

--




Contract & Compensation:

For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).




Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.

--




Selection Process:

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).

Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.

Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.

--




Why Join Our Team?

Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.

Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.

Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Show more
HTML:
Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,500,000 users come true!


We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals (with 0 to 3 years of experience) who aspire to join our team across Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a relevant role becomes available and your profile matches our requirements.


For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EU Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work in one of our offices or fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.


We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.

--


Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

  • Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
  • Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.
  • Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
  • Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.
  • Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
  • Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.


--


What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:

  • Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.
  • Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
  • Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
  • Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
  • Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.
  • Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
  • Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.

--


Who We Are:

Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.


We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.


Our community includes over 1,500,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

--


Contract & Compensation:

For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).


Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.

--


Selection Process:

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).

Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.

Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.

--


Why Join Our Team?

Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.

Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.

Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Brussels

Type: Freelance (Daily Rate)

Duration: 6 Months, with potential extension

Start Date: ASAP




Montash has partnered with a leading organisation to deliver production-ready AI solutions, and we’re now looking to engage a freelance AI/ML Engineer with a strong focus on industrialising machine learning pipelines.




The Role:

As an AI/ML Engineer, you’ll act as the bridge between Data Science and IT Production, ensuring that ML models are not only functional but fully integrated, monitored, and scalable in a production environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Build and automate robust ML pipelines ready for production deployment
Collaborate closely with Data Scientists to translate models into scalable solutions
Support deployment with CI/CD pipelines, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and infrastructure alignment
Ensure continuous monitoring, retraining, and version control of models in live environments
Drive integration of AI services with appropriate data flow, ingestion, and real-time architecture




Required Experience:

3+ years in ML engineering or related production environments
Strong hands-on skills with Python (incl. async programming & optimisation)
Experience with Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab CI/CD, and PostgreSQL
Knowledge of AI platforms, Spark, ELT/ETL tools, and data visualisation is a plus
Agile mindset with strong communication skills and stakeholder awareness
Fluent in English and ideally Dutch/French




Interested?

If you're immediately available and this sounds like the right fit, please get in touch today with your CV and availability to shaip@montash.nl

Show more

Title: Data Science Manager AI
Description:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.




What is the job about?

Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…




Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch and English is required. (French is a plus)




We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Show more

Title: Computer Scientist- Python and SQL Programmer
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Python and SQL programmer to optimize and extend a production data analysis tool. This role involves refining an existing Python script, consolidating distributed JSON files into an efficient data store, and integrating analytics into a Qt-based application with graphical reporting capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Debug and enhance a Python script used for analyzing production data, specifically resolving issues related to die location within wafers.
Design and implement a structured, scalable database using SQL or Parquet formats to support fast querying and large dataset handling.
Generate graph-rich, insightful reports that communicate key production trends and metrics.
Embed the data analysis and reporting functionality into an existing Python/Qt application through a robust API.
Optimize for performance to ensure smooth handling of large volumes of data




Location: Leuven, Flemish Region, Belgium




Required Skills and Qualifications

Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL
Strong experience with data mining and manipulation of large datasets
Familiarity with data formats such as JSON and Parquet
Experience with graphical reporting libraries (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
Knowledge of Qt for Python (PyQt or PySide)
Exposure to JMP or Machine Learning techniques is a plus




We Offer

We provide a dynamic and rewarding temporary assignment where you'll work on meaningful, high-impact technology. You'll be part of a collaborative team striving to solve complex challenges and push the boundaries of what’s possible. A dynamic and multidisciplinary community dedicated to shaping the technologies of the future
Assignment Type: Full-time.
Work Schedule: 40 hours per week
Hybrid working model: combine remote work with in-office collaboration
The role provides flexibility, responsibility, and the chance to shape a product from the ground up
Supportive and flexible work culture promoting a healthy work-life balance
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Engineer (Medior / Senior)
Description:
Bij Sensr combineren we industriële inzichten met slimme data-oplossingen om productieprocessen te optimaliseren. Onze missie is om industriële bedrijven duurzaam efficiënter laten werken door data-gedreven beslissingen. We zijn op zoek naar een medior of senior data engineer/scientist die ons team versterkt met technische expertise, conceptueel denkvermogen en een passie voor impact.




Wat ga je doen?

Binnen deze rol werk je aan het volledige traject van industriële data: van het ontsluiten van ruwe machinestromen tot het modelleren van voorspellende algoritmen en het bouwen van schaalbare oplossingen voor onze klanten.




Je takenpakket

Het bouwen van end-to-end oplossingen die connecteren met industriële systemen (zoals OPC UA, PLC's, historians…) om live data toegankelijk en bruikbaar te maken.
Het verwerken en structureren van grote hoeveelheden operationele data tot een begrijpbaar geheel via onze dataplatformen (Azure, Databricks, Spark, Fabric, … ).
Het ontwikkelen van modellen die inzichten opleveren uit tijdsseries, procesdata en andere industriële bronnen, met technieken zoals statistische procescontrole, ML-algoritmes, optimalisatie en deep learning.
Het vertalen van technologische mogelijkheden naar concrete verbeteringen samen met ons team én de klant.




Wie ben jij?

Jij bent iemand die:

Graag werkt op het kruispunt tussen engineering, data-analyse & AI.
Snel structuur ziet in complexe systemen en abstract kan denken.
Niet bang is om hands-on te zijn: in code, in de cloud of op de fabrieksvloer.
Heldere communicatie belangrijk vindt en goed kan samenwerken in teamverband.
Ownership en flexibiliteit waardeert in je werk.




Je hebt ervaring met:

Je bent vlot in Python, SQL, PySpark
Cloud-omgevingen (Azure is een plus).
AI-technieken zoals classificatie, regressie, anomaly detection, deep learning of reinforcement learning.
Data-engineering concepten zoals event streaming (Kafka, EventHub), schaalbare ETL, API-integratie of data-opslag (HDFS, Delta Lake…).
Het ontwikkelen van betrouwbare en performante oplossingen in een industriële of productiecontext (is een pluspunt).




Bonuspunten

Certificering hebt in Azure (Data Engineer, Architect of Scientist).
Ervaring hebt met industriële communicatieprotocollen (OPC UA, Modbus, etc.).
Kennis hebt van standaarden zoals ISA-95, ISA-88.
Interesse hebt in productieplanning, optimalisatie-algoritmes of procesautomatisering.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een sleutelrol in een innovatief en snelgroeiend datateam met grote impact op onze klanten.
Uitdagende en gevarieerde projecten in industriële omgevingen
Een cultuur van vertrouwen, ondernemerschap en heldere communicatie.
Flexibele werkuren, hybride werkopties en een no-nonsense aanpak.
Lerende omgeving: toegang tot de nieuwste technologieën en ruimte voor innovatie.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About

A precision medicine startup is building a team to apply cutting-edge AI to immune-mediated diseases, transforming research into real-world clinical solutions. The role involves developing and deploying LLM- and RAG-powered systems that drive decision-making in diagnostics, treatment, and drug development.

Responsibilities


Model Development: Design and optimise transformer-based models for clinical, transcriptomic, or histology data, focusing on pretraining, fine-tuning, and large-scale benchmarking.
ML Infrastructure: Build scalable ML pipelines and deploy models with MLOps best practices (versioning, monitoring, retraining).
Data Scaling: Convert raw data into scalable, deep learning–ready loaders for millions of datapoints.


Requirements:


Master’s or PhD in ML, Computer Science, or related field
3+ years with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX)
Strong Python skills; experience with production ML (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP/Azure)
MLOps/DevOps: ML pipelines (e.g., Kubeflow, MLflow), Git, CI/CD, IaC
Experience in GPU programming, distributed training, and model optimisation


NOTE: VISA SPONSORSHIP IS NOT PROVIDED.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

🔥 Your Responsibilities:



Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.



🎯 Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.



🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
Show more
HTML:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

🔥 Your Responsibilities:


  • Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
  • Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
  • Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
  • Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
  • Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.


🎯 Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.


  • Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
  • Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
  • Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
  • Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.


🚀 Advantages:


  • An international learning environment.
  • Extensive training and certifications.
  • A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
  • The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
  • Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
  • An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.


💡 We are an independent company that values:


  • Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
  • International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
  • Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
  • Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.


Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
