Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Don’t settle for just any consulting company—choose the one that’s right for you!




We’re on the lookout for an AI Engineer to join our expanding AI & Data start-up.




As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.




You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn’t the job for you if you’re looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. 🚀




As an AI Engineer, your mission would include:

Collaborating with clients to define business and technical requirements for AI and data-driven solutions.
Designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions tailored to various industries.
Working with stakeholders to identify and implement AI strategies that drive business value.
Ensuring models are production-ready, scalable, and adhere to best DevOps/MLOps practices.
Leveraging cloud environments, particularly Azure, to optimize data processing and AI model performance.
Engaging with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, AI engineers, and consultants, to deliver high-quality AI solutions.
Supporting the continuous improvement of AI methodologies and contributing to internal innovations within the company.
Mentoring junior team members and sharing knowledge across the organization.
Attending client meetings and presenting findings, recommendations, and AI solutions in a clear and structured manner.







You’re a step closer to joining our team if you bring:

Background:

A bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field (such as business or engineering).
3-4 years of experience in a consulting environment or a related AI/ML engineering role.
Experience working at the intersection of consulting, machine learning engineering, and data science.

Technical Skills:

Strong expertise in Python and SQL.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning, AI, and statistical techniques.
Hands-on experience with NLP is a significant plus.
Proficiency in cloud environments, particularly Azure.
Familiarity with popular machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Experience deploying AI/ML models into production and working with LLMs in a real-world setting.
Knowledge of best practices in DevOps/MLOps.

Soft Skills:

Strong client-facing skills with the ability to translate business problems into AI-driven solutions.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment.
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for innovation and continuous learning.




Practical Info:

Languages: fluent in English and in French or Dutch.







We know that finding the right job isn’t just about the role—it’s about what’s in it for you, too. While we’re a start-up, we’re big on taking care of our people right from day one.







Here’s a sneak peek at what we offer:

💰 A compensation package that keeps you motivated:

Competitive salary
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
30 days of paid time off
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Representation allowances
Hospitalization & dental insurance
Meal vouchers
Opportunity to earn company stock over time

🎯 A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:

Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Hybrid work model
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles 🎮
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments 🧘
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ☕

✨ And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!







Our Recruitment Process:

Quick intro call with our HR team
HR Interview
Case study/Technical Interview
Business Interview
Interview with client







How to apply?

You can apply right here on LinkedIn.




If you’re passionate about what we do but aren’t sure you meet every single requirement—don’t hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.




Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together 🤝




Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions — and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

You can apply right here on LinkedIn.

At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.


Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together 🤝


Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions — and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Based in Belgium)
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of data-driven decisions?




About the job

🤠 What you’ll be doing

Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine learning models to solve high-impact business challenges
Architect and build robust, scalable data pipelines and data-driven solutions
Drive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, correlations, and strategic insights
Develop and maintain complex predictive models, recommendation engines, and optimization algorithms
Translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for business leaders
Validate, monitor, and continuously improve model performance in production environments
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure data quality and alignment with business goals
Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering technical excellence within the team
Play a strategic role in shaping Movify’s data science vision, methodologies, and best practices







🤓 Skills & qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar advanced analytics role
Expert proficiency in Python or R, with a strong command of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Deep expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) and experience deploying models in production
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large, complex datasets in real-world environments
Solid background in statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing, with the ability to design rigorous experiments
Practical experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control tools (e.g., Git)
Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including C-level audiences
A strategic, proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Fluent in FR or NL + excellent command of English
A genuine passion for transforming data into business value and driving strategic decision-making







😍 Movify Offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology, data, and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join a progressive environment where your contributions will shape the future of mobility through innovative data solutions. Be a part of a team that values safety, sustainability, and advanced technology in the rail transport industry.


We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist who possesses a blend of leadership and technical expertise, ready to tackle complex challenges that drive operational excellence and innovation.


You lead the design and implementation of advanced data science solutions using machine learning, deep learning, and GenAI techniques.
You act as a mentor and scientific authority for a team of skilled data scientists.
You collaborate with cross-functional teams including operations, IT, and sustainability.
You translate complex business challenges into data-driven solutions.
You ensure best practices in model development, validation, and deployment.
You drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and methodologies within the team.


What are we looking for?


You hold a PhD or Master in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or AI field.
You have 10+ years of experience in data science, with a strong track record in both academic research and industrial applications.
You have proven expertise in Azure cloud services and Databricks (including Spark, MLflow, Delta Lake, etc.).
You demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.
You exhibit excellent communication and presentation skills.
You are fluent in English, knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

#STEM2025

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

#STEM2025

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
  • Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
  • Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
  • Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
  • Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
  • Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
  • Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills
  • Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
  • Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
  • Willingness to travel up to 50%
  • Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

Title: Middle Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At SPD Technology, we bring together a team of like-minded people who are driven by the desire to bring value through their work, united in their commitment to high performance and delivering custom, cutting-edge tech solutions that drive clients’ growth. We empower our people with a culture of excellence and enable them with the opportunity to uphold their accountability to contribute on each level. We value humanity and collaboration, encourage professional and personal growth, and foster a supportive and flexible work environment where everyone’s contribution is welcomed.




We are looking for a Middle ML & AI Engineer to join us as part of our team.




About the role

PitchBook’s Machine Learning Engineer is responsible for using machine learning, statistical modeling, and natural language processing (NLP) to collect a high-volume of data for the PitchBook Platform and surface insights for the capital markets. A strong motivation to succeed is critical and everyone has the opportunity to shape the long-term direction of our team.




About the project

PitchBook — a platform for investment professionals. Our software provides access to data and the analytical tools to get answers fast and discover promising opportunities. Uncovers actionable insights and trends hidden within the financial data of more than three million companies. Users all over the world include large corporations, start-ups, venture capital and private equity firms, investment banks, and many others. Features of PitchBook: Advanced search / Discovery & insights / Company profiles / Workflow & efficiency / Financials and many more.




Team

Engineering Manager, Lead Engineer, 2 ML Engineers, 2 Backend Engineers, 1 Frontend Engineer, and 3 Automation QA Engineers.




Work Environment

The role offers a flexible work schedule, allowing you to adapt your working hours with the requirement to attend all team meetings. The team follows a Scrum-based Agile methodology.




As a qualified expert, You will




Work with GenAI & LLMs: Design, develop, and fine-tune generative AI models using transformer architectures. Implement advanced techniques to create practical solutions for real-world challenges.
Use Modern Toolkits: Leverage frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith to build automated pipelines and intelligent agents. Integrate these tools with vector databases for efficient similarity search and real-time analysis.
Extract Data Insights: Process and analyze large volumes of unstructured data using embeddings and statistical modeling to identify meaningful insights.
Build Scalable Systems: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create production-grade ML systems that handle real-time, high-volume data processing.
Collaborate & Communicate: Work with Product and Engineering teams to improve data management and support innovation. Present complex analyses clearly and effectively.
Tech Stack & Focus Areas: Work with generative AI and transformer models, integrating frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith to automate workflows and build intelligent systems. Use PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, and Spacy to build NLP pipelines. Implement vector databases for high-dimensional data embeddings and develop hybrid models to extract insights from diverse data sources.




We’re looking for you if you have




Bachelor's/master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or related fields.
2+ years of experience in a similar role in a production environment.
Experience in transformer-based language models
Proficient in deep learning frameworks (i.e, TensorFlow and PyTorch)
Demonstrated experience with natural language processing.
Demonstrated experience with Python or other object-oriented programming frameworks.
Demonstrated experience in using SQL for data extraction.
Strong communication and data presentation skills.
Strong problem-solving ability.
Ability to communicate complex analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
Experience working closely with software development team(s) is a plus.
Experience building scalable systems in production is a plus.
Knowledge of financial services, investment, banking, VC, and/or PE is desired but not required.




What’s in it for You




Reveal great tech solutions

Join the team of experts who create custom, cutting-edge tech solutions for world-renowned businesses, fueling client growth. Unleash your potential, tackle new challenges, and be part of a team that values your skills and contributions. Focus on long-term impact and building tailored, long-lasting partnerships with our clients.




Experience an agile and flexible working environment

Enjoy the freedom of fully remote work with a flexible working schedule. Empower yourself with a stable workload and a stable income, supported by provided laptops and licensed software. We focus on lasting cooperation and unite result-oriented individuals who stand on a high-performance approach to work.




Embrace the opportunity for personal and professional growth

Benefit from performance and merit reviews, elevate your skills with personal development plans, and individual learnings through the corporate library, public speaking support, and more.




Be among like-minded people

Work with a team of one mind who cares about what they do and how they do. Collaborate with top-notch experts who are always ready to help and support you through any challenges. Join company-wide tech and cultural events, and contribute to meaningful CSR initiatives that resonate with your values. Feel supported by your HR, and take advantage of our referral bonus program.




Interview steps

Pre-Screening with the recruiter
Tech Interview + Live Coding (up to 1,5 hours)
System Design interview (up to 45 min)
Final interview with Engineering Manager (30 min)

Be among like-minded people

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We're searching for an AI/Data Engineer – Power the Next Wave of Generative AI!




Are you passionate about building and scaling AI-powered solutions that transform Sales, Customer Service, and Supply Chain? Join an agile, cross-functional team and become the driving force behind cutting-edge Generative AI use cases!




At Remobi, we partner with innovative organisations across Europe and North America to rapidly scale engineering teams and accelerate product delivery. Built around a strong community of nearshore experts, we pride ourselves on our agile, human‑first approach—The Remobi Way




The Challenge:

As an AI Document Processing Engineer (Remote, Europe), you’ll build agent‑based applications to support gas and turbine plant clients. Your goal is to transform complex document types—PDFs, technical drawings, and metadata—into structured formats ready for intelligent backend agents.




How You Will Make an Impact:

Ingest and onboard diverse document sources from client environments
Research and prototype using Python libraries and tools (e.g., Azure Document Intelligence) to extract structured information from unstructured materials.
Design and implement data pipelines to deliver clean, reliable output to agentic systems.
Integrate FastAPI-based services (or Flask/Django) to support backend workflows.
Implement search and indexing layers using Elasticsearch or Searcher IO.
Deploy and manage these pipelines on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Ensure high-quality delivery through pytest-driven tests, validating robustness and reliability.
Collaborate effectively in English with cross-functional and distributed teams.




What You Bring:

Strong Python skills, with hands‑on experience in document and technical‑drawing processing.
Proficiency in FastAPI (or Flask/Django) for building backend services.
Experience with tools like Azure Document Intelligence for PDF/drawing extraction.
Knowledge of search/index solutions such as Elasticsearch or Searcher IO.
Cloud deployment expertise on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Dedication to test-driven development using pytest.




About the Opportunity

This AI-focused data-engineering role serves energy-sector clients, shedding light on real-world challenges in gas and turbine documentation. You’ll join a fully remote, Europe-based team, working on cutting-edge agentic ingestion pipelines with a focus on quality and scalability.




What Makes This Role Special:

Innovate with Generative AI across core business functions – you’ll see the impact of your work daily
Fantastic flexibility as a b2b/freelance contract, fully remote
Work in a true cross-disciplinary delivery team, bridging data science, engineering and business
Access to our Remobi Community - industry updates, networking events, contract support and more!




Ready to Shape the Future of AI as an AI/Data Engineer?

Join us and help build the GenAI backbone of tomorrow’s leading enterprises. Apply now and let’s innovate together!

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Twenty8 is an independent firm delivering IT services to international organizations, with a focus on supporting digital transformation, business development, and customer-centric solutions.

We collaborate closely with European Union public institutions and agencies, helping skilled professionals navigate and grow in their international careers.


We are currently seeking an AI Engineer for a prestigious European Institution in Brussels. 🔍🇪🇺


🖥️ KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Design, develop and maintain scalable back-end services using Java and Python for AI-powered applications;
  • Integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) into production environments, including building RAG pipelines and chatbot interfaces;
  • Implement and manage databases (relational and NoSQL) with a focus on vector embeddings and AI data processing;
  • Collaborate on the selection, adaptation and deployment of AI frameworks and libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch/LangChain/Haystack).


📝 REQUIREMENTS:


  • 5-10 years of professional experience in software development and integration;
  • Excellent knowledge of Java Spring and/or PPH Drupal development;
  • Good knowledge of Haystack, LangChain or equivalent frameworks;
  • Knowledge of Python programming with exposure to either TensorFlow or PyTorch frameworks or library;
  • Hands-on experience developing AI-powered applications (chatbots, LLM interfaces, RAG pipelines);
  • Master's degree in Computer Science or relevant fields;
  • Fluency in English (C1);
  • Ability to work in multicultural and international settings.


This is a hybrid role, requiring on-site presence at the Brussels office 1 day per week. 📍


Ready to Apply?

If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!

Submit your CV today and embark on an exciting journey with us! 📩

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development – Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right – Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership – Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching – Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
SamanTree Medical is an innovative Belgian-Swiss medical device company dedicated to improving patient care and operating room efficiency through breakthrough imaging technology. The company develops and manufactures the Histolog Scanner, an advanced imaging solution that enables real-time analysis of fresh tissue samples. This visualization modality supports a wide range of surgical and diagnostic applications. SamanTree Medical is actively commercializing the Histolog Scanner across Europe and the United States.




SamanTree is built on the passion and dedication of talented people from diverse backgrounds. We believe that breakthrough ideas can come from anywhere, so we foster a culture rooted in diversity, respect, and open-mindedness. Leading with inclusion, we empower our team members to bring their best, most authentic selves to work each day.




Our culture thrives on purpose-driven individuals who aspire to make a meaningful impact. Team members here are grounded in integrity, eager to learn, fueled by energy, and bring a wealth of diverse, real-world perspectives that drive innovative thinking. We’re committed to our people’s long-term growth, actively investing in their potential to advance our mission and inspire them to achieve their highest potential.




Join a team setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra-Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

For more information, please visit https://www.samantree.com/




To ensure the growth of SamanTree Medical, we are looking for:




Data Scientist, Lausanne (Switzerland)




In the R&D department, we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. You will contribute to the development of digital products and extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, making them available to relevant teams to support data-driven decision-making and operational improvements.

Responsibilities

Developing deep sector-specific data expertise in confocal microscopy images, to actively contribute to data annotation activities and coordinate outsourced image annotation workflows
Selecting, organizing, managing, and preserving data to ensure its long-term value and accessibility for specific users or purposes
Interacting with colleagues from a cross-functional team on various data-related projects for understanding the needs for technical data solutions, defining solutions concepts and design, providing training and retrieving feedback.
Collaborating closely to the development of data analytics based components under design control, in accordance with ISO 13485 and FDA Quality System Regulations.
Conducting feasibility and proof-of-concept projects to further improve and standardize the performances, usability and adoption of SamanTree Medical’s products
Performing technical reviews and contributing to the development of test procedures of existing data processes




Skills, Qualifications and Experience

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
You are attentive to details and committed to maintaining data accuracy and quality.
You have experience in applying data science techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably on images. 1 to 3 years of experience in a similar position is a plus.
You are proficient in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
You are a strong team player with the ability to collaborate across interdisciplinary teams.
You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English, both written and spoken; you communicate fluently in French (spoken).




At least one of the following applies to you :

You have a strong interest in data visualization and enjoy transforming data into clear, compelling visuals
You enjoy digging into databases of text and/or images until you find the answer to a complex data question
You are enthusiastic about AI and machine learning and have experience with training models on images




Our offer

A 100 % or 80 % job
Primarily on-site work (maximum 1 day homeworking per week)
An attractive and competitive salary package in line with your profile and experience
A challenging and diversified position within a high-potential fast-growing innovative medical device company.
A human-size, dynamic, respectful, and collaborative work environment
International exposure, with learning and development opportunities.
A role that directly contributes to the improvement of global healthcare outcomes




How to Apply

Please combine your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and language skills into a single document and submit it via the LinkedIn "CV upload" option.




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are all proud to work for such a great company as Samantree Medical. And we would be even prouder to have you on board. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, regardless of your race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Please apply if you see a position that makes your heartbeat, and if you feel the role is appealing to you. If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

SamanTree is an emerging company with significant potential in the MedTech sector. For individuals seeking challenges, SamanTree offers opportunities for growth both nationally and internationally. We value inquisitive and highly committed individuals who are dedicated to collaborating towards making SamanTree a success.




Join a team that’s setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

Show more

Title: Head of AI & Data Science
Description:
Company Overview

Imagine leveraging your expertise in AI and data science to directly improve the lives of millions of people living with hypertension. Hilo by Aktiia, is revolutionizing how cardiovascular health is monitored and managed. They've developed and commercialized the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor, empowering both patients and physicians with unprecedented insights into blood pressure patterns. Backed by over $100M in funding from top-tier investors across Europe and the US, Hilo is an early-stage, fast-growing startup rooted in over 20 years of research at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Their CE-certified, Class IIa medical device is already available in over 10 countries worldwide—and they're just getting started.

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities


Team & Project Leadership


Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.


Cross-functional Collaboration


Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.


People Development


Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.


External Engagement


Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.


Process Optimization


Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile


Academic Background


PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.


Technical Expertise


5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.


Leadership Experience


Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.


Industry Fit


Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.


Language Skills


English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.


Personality


Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‘art of the possible’.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team’s solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team’s velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities

  • Team & Project Leadership

Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration

Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.

  • People Development

Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.

  • External Engagement

Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.

  • Process Optimization

Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile

  • Academic Background

PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.

  • Technical Expertise

5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.

  • Leadership Experience

Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.

  • Industry Fit

Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.

  • Language Skills

English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.

  • Personality

Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (100% remote)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we are at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence with brain-computer interface technologies. Our projects leverage deep learning, generative models, and representation learning to decode and interpret brain activity. With our foundation in both established and cutting-edge AI infrastructure, our mission is to bridge the gap between AI and neuroimaging, driving innovation that’s not only revolutionary but also accessible, transparent, and privacy-focused.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled machine learning engineer to join our dynamic Brain & AI team. This role focuses on developing AI models that enhance our understanding of neural mechanisms building encoding and decoding models and apply this knowledge to real-world applications such as brain computer interfaces. You will be instrumental in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in AI and neuroscience, helping to solve some of the most complex and fascinating challenges in the field today.

Responsibilities


Develop and evaluate scalable deep learning algorithms that are central to our brain decoding initiatives.
Collaborate closely with data scientists to pioneer research in generative modeling and representation learning.
Identify bottlenecks in data processing pipelines and devise effective solutions, improving performance and reliability.
Maintain high standards of code quality, organization, and automatization across all projects.
Adapt machine learning and neural network algorithms to optimize performance in various computing environments, including distributed clusters and GPUs.
Write and revise papers, participate in conferences, communicate and disseminate results.


Basic Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Physics, Math, Neuroscience or another quantitative field.
3+ years of experience of working in industry or research.
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in developing machine learning algorithms or infrastructure using Python and PyTorch.
Experience in deep learning techniques such as supervised, semi-supervised, self-supervised learning, and/or generative modeling.
Strong scientific background and ability to formulate and test novel hypotheses with proper experiments, draw conclusions and support claims.
Proficient in managing unstructured datasets with strong analytical skills.
Demonstrated project management and organizational skills.
Proven ability to support and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


PhD and research experience in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Physics, Math, Neuroscience or another quantitative field.
Scientific publications in top-tier AI and neuroscience conferences (NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, AAAI, CVPR, Cosyne, SFN, CNN ecc) or peer reviewed journals
Familiarity with deep learning libraries such as Pytorch, Huggingface, Transformers, Accelerator and Diffuser.
Hands-on experience in training and fine-tuning generative models like diffusion models or large language models such as GPTs and LLAMAs.
Experience with data and model visualization tools.
Experience with non-invasive neural data (fMRI, EEG, MEG) or invasive neural recordings (ECoG, MEA, ecc).


Important information for candidates

Recruitment scams have become increasingly common. To protect yourself, please keep the following in mind when applying for roles:


Apply only through our official channels. We do not use third-party platforms or agencies for recruitment unless clearly stated. All open roles are listed on our official careers page: https://tether.recruitee.com/
Verify the recruiter’s identity. All our recruiters have verified LinkedIn profiles. If you’re unsure, you can confirm their identity by checking their profile or contacting us through our website.
Be cautious of unusual communication methods. We do not conduct interviews over WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS. All communication is done through official company emails and platforms.
Double-check email addresses. All communication from us will come from emails ending in @tether.to or @tether.io
We will never request payment or financial details. If someone asks for personal financial information or payment at any point during the hiring process, it is a scam. Please report it immediately.


When in doubt, feel free to reach out through our official website.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

This Data Science position is embedded within the Analytics Team, which plays a pivotal role in developing tools and analyses that drive the day-to-day operations of Vitol. The successful candidate will leverage data science and machine learning to revolutionize how Vitol tracks and anticipates commodity movements across the globe.

While regular collaboration with the central Data Science team is expected, this role is uniquely positioned within the team of developers and analysts focused on vessel and cargo flows. This setup fosters knowledge exchange, process improvements, and regular interaction with various business units that depend on these analyses.

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on approach, ready to dive deep into data, build models, create visualizations, and deliver actionable insights as needed. They will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be motivated by seeing their work have an immediate impact on Vitol’s operations.

Key Responsabilities :


Be an energetic and enthusiastic team member, uniquely positioned to harness the power of data to transform the inner workings of the commodities industry
Gain a deep understanding of Vitol’s core operations and develop creative solutions using data, automation, analytics, models, and optimization to enhance these operations
Explore new datasets and external vendor predictions/algorithms, extract meaningful insights, and present results through visualizations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work closely with domain experts to design and implement machine learning solutions that are both understandable and usable by non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with the central Data Science team and IT department to leverage existing tools and capabilities to deliver value to the business


Qualifications


Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent experience
Strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional datasets is essential
Proficiency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development environment
Experience in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences using tools such as D3.js, Bokeh, Plotly or similar frameworks
5-7 years of industry experience as a data scientist on real-world datasets, is preferred
C# development experience is a plus
French language skills are an advantage but not required


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


Proven experience in working within an Agile Scrum development model
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proactive and user-focused approach, embodying a "make it work" mentality, with a genuine interest in both the functional and technical aspects of challenges encountered
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration across diverse teams
Fluent in English, with full proficiency in business communication, both verbal and written
Passionate about leveraging data science and machine learning to innovate and disrupt traditionally human-centric industries
Skilled in deriving, abstracting, and translating value from complex models into actionable insights within a commercial context
Resourceful, creative, and adaptable, thriving in fast-paced, results-driven environments


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Our Geneva office is located very centrally, 5 minutes from the main train station and 1 minute from the lake. The office has a rooftop lunch area, with views over the lake and Alps.
We organize regular activities to enable our people to meet colleagues from other teams in an informal setting, and to celebrate special achievements
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
Description:
Qui nous sommes




SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :




> Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries

> Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées

> Un système qualité performant

> Des services adaptables et évolutifs




Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !

Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.







Missions




Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.







Profil




5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.







Informations complémentaires




Date de début : dès que possible
Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
Durée : Long terme
Langue : Français et anglais
Nationalité européenne requise
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Show more

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.


Particularly, you will get to:



  • Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

  • Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.

  • Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.

  • All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.

  • Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.

  • Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.


In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements

Ideally, you have:



  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

  • Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.

  • Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.

  • Experience with building and shipping software solutions.

  • Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.


Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.


Interested? Contact us!


We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect is responsible for building, deploying, and scaling advanced machine learning (ML) and optimization models on AWS to solve high-impact business problems in supply chain management. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of cloud-based technologies, capable of enhancing existing code and improving model performance. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, enhance existing cloud-based pipelines, and ensure smooth operation of production models. Additionally, you will contribute to automating KPI reports and support data-driven decision-making across the business.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Advanced Data Science Models: Apply statistical and machine learning models to supply chain management, with a focus on improving cost-efficiency and customer satisfaction.
AI & ML Systems: Develop and deploy AI/ML systems for process optimization, such as scheduling problems, and simulate various delivery scenarios.
Cloud-Based Enhancements: Enhance existing cloud-based data science solutions, implement new ML algorithms, and perform rigorous benchmarking to improve performance.
AWS Cloud Integration: Work with AWS cloud tools (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, etc.) to develop and deploy scalable AI/ML pipelines.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and visualize data to derive actionable business insights and improve workflows.
KPI Automation: Design, prepare, and automate KPI reports to support strategic decision-making.
Monitoring & Validation: Write test and validation scripts to monitor cloud performance, data latency, and ensure data output quality.
Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align solutions with operational and business goals.
Documentation: Ensure comprehensive documentation of data processes, modeling strategies, and system designs to facilitate knowledge transfer and system maintainability.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, AI, and cloud technologies to continuously improve the organization's analytical capabilities.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

5+ years of hands-on experience in data science, AI/ML.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries.
Deep knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and optimization methods.
Experience with AWS technologies (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, Glue, Athena, etc.).
Experience working on optimization and scheduling (Python libraries preferred).
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows.
Experience in supply chain management.
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs.
Show more
